dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools
dependencies.name: autoconf

dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools
dependencies.name: automake

dependencies.description: GNU binutils, which contain the linker, assembler, objdump and others
dependencies.name: binutils

dependencies.description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.
dependencies.name: boost

dependencies.description:
CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by
NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by
harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU). Note: This
package does not currently install the drivers necessary to run CUDA.
These will need to be installed manually. See:
https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/ for details.
dependencies.name: cuda

dependencies.description:
API for dynamic binary instrumentation. Modify programs while they are
executing without recompiling, re-linking, or re-executing.
dependencies.name: dyninst

dependencies.description:
libelf lets you read, modify or create ELF object files in an
architecture-independent way. The library takes care of size and endian
issues, e.g. you can process a file for SPARC processors on an Intel-
based system. Note: libelf is no longer maintained and packages that
depend on libelf should migrate to elfutils.
dependencies.name: elf

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description:
The DWARF Debugging Information Format is of interest to programmers
working on compilers and debuggers (and any one interested in reading or
writing DWARF information). It was developed by a committee (known as
the PLSIG at the time) starting around 1991. Starting around 1991 SGI
developed the libdwarf and dwarfdump tools for internal use and as part
of SGI IRIX developer tools. Since that time dwarfdump and libdwarf have
been shipped (as an executable and archive respectively, not source)
with every release of the SGI MIPS/IRIX C compiler.
dependencies.name: libdwarf

dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.
dependencies.name: libtool

dependencies.description:
A portable and efficient C programming interface (API) to determine the
call-chain of a program.
dependencies.name: libunwind

dependencies.description:
Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project
(but usable outside of the Gnome platform), it is free software
available under the MIT License.
dependencies.name: libxml2

dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.
dependencies.name: m4

dependencies.description: IBM MPI implementation from Spectrum MPI.
dependencies.name: mpi

dependencies.description:
PAPI provides the tool designer and application engineer with a
consistent interface and methodology for use of the performance counter
hardware found in most major microprocessors. PAPI enables software
engineers to see, in near real time, the relation between software
performance and processor events. In addition Component PAPI provides
access to a collection of components that expose performance measurement
opportunities across the hardware and software stack.
dependencies.name: papi

dependent_to.description:
OmpSs is an effort to integrate features from the StarSs programming
model developed by BSC into a single programming model. In particular,
our objective is to extend OpenMP with new directives to support
asynchronous parallelism and heterogeneity (devices like GPUs). However,
it can also be understood as new directives extending other accelerator
based APIs like CUDA or OpenCL. Our OmpSs environment is built on top of
our Mercurium compiler and Nanos++ runtime system.
dependent_to.name: ompss

dependent_to.description:
OmpSs-2 is a data-flow shared-memory programming model based on source
annotations. It is developed by the Barcelona Supercomputing Center as a
successor to the StarSs and OmpSs programming models.
dependent_to.name: ompss-2

description:
Extrae is the package devoted to generate tracefiles which can be
analyzed later by Paraver. Extrae is a tool that uses different
interposition mechanisms to inject probes into the target application so
as to gather information regarding the application performance. The
Extrae instrumentation package can instrument the MPI programin model,
and the following parallel programming models either alone or in
conjunction with MPI : OpenMP, CUDA, OpenCL, pthread, OmpSs
name: extrae

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system

variants.description: Use dyninst for dynamic code installation
variants.name: dyninst

variants.description: Use PAPI to collect performance counters
variants.name: papi

variants.description: Enable single MPI instrumentation library that supports both Fortran and C
variants.name: single-mpi-lib
